Posts.Title: Stage III Cancer Survivors .... 10+ Years and Out AlwaysHope karen1956

Posts.Content: May 26, 2015 02:23AM TaniaE wrote: Thumbs up to you Weesa. One thing I couldn't give up after diagnosis was my weekend treat which is a few glasses of red wine. I think to myself after everything we've been through we should be able to enjoy a few things in life.
Posts.Title: Stage III Cancer Survivors .... 10+ Years and Out AlwaysHope karen1956

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2014 08:54PM TaniaE wrote: Finished rads in May and had a "knot in my throat" feeling during rads and for quite a few weeks afterwards. I was radiated up to the collarbone and my rads doctor told me that it was normal. In fact I was on a clinical trial where I had to fill out a questionnaire every day and give them a score between 1-10 on how my throat was feeling every day and how difficult it was to swallow. So yes, it is a common side effect of rads.
Posts.Title: Difficulty swallowing, a radiation side efffect? nanabolini yoga_girl
